results.body: Following talks with Israeli officials in Jerusalem, the U.S. secretary of state, Antony J. Blinken, met the Palestinian leadership in the occupied West Bank city of Ramallah amid a sharp rise in tensions in the region.
results.byline: By Michael Crowley and Patrick Kingsley
results.title: Blinken Meets With Palestinian Leader After Surge in Violence

results.body: The future may bring a one-state solution, a two-state solution or one really big mess.
results.title: What in the World Is Happening in Israel?

results.body: Surging violence claimed the lives of four Palestinians and an Israeli soldier over the weekend, raising tensions on the eve of a Jewish holiday.
results.title: A Deadly Shooting at an Israeli Checkpoint Sets Jerusalem on Edge

results.body: The life of Ibrahim al-Nabulsi, the son of a Palestinian security official, reflects some of the dynamics at play as leaders jockey to succeed Mahmoud Abbas, the Palestinian Authority president.
results.title: Killing of Young Gunman Highlights Shifts in Fast-Changing West Bank

results.body: After eight months in office, Olaf Scholz is still struggling to find his footing, drawing questions over a tax scandal and criticism of his response to a Holocaust remark made at his side.
results.title: Germany’s Stony-Faced Chancellor Faces Critics on Nearly Every Side

results.body: Facing international condemnation, the Palestinian Authority president, Mahmoud Abbas, later walked back the remarks he had made at a news conference in Berlin.
results.title: Palestinian Leader Accused Israel of ‘50 Holocausts,’ Causing an Uproar

results.body: To Israelis, President Biden’s visit was mostly a source of celebration of growing ties with Arab countries. For the Palestinians, Mr. Biden brought funding and sympathy — but no long-term plans.
results.title: Biden’s Mideast Message: Good News for Israel, Small Steps for Palestinians

results.body: Demonstrators express frustration with Washington’s support for Israel and the Biden administration’s policies toward Palestinians.
results.title: As Israelis praise Biden, some Palestinians protest over his visit.

results.body: Hussein al-Sheikh is considered a possible successor to Mahmoud Abbas, 87, the Palestinian Authority president. But as a liaison to Israel, some critics call him a “spokesman of the occupation.”
results.title: A New Palestinian Leader Rises in the West Bank. He’s Very Unpopular.

results.body: The White House formally announced that President Biden would visit the oil-rich kingdom in mid-July despite having denounced it as a “pariah” state after the assassination of a dissident.

nytd_des: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

results.title: Biden Trip to Saudi Arabia Is Set, but Energy Help Is Not
